thread.title: Johnny Manziel: I hope I still have love in Cleveland
thread.title_full: Johnny Manziel: I hope I still have love in Cleveland

title: Johnny Manziel: I hope I still have love in Cleveland
text:
Johnny Manziel: I hope I still have love in Cleveland Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel hopes the city still supports him after off-the-field issues. Post to Facebook Johnny Manziel: I hope I still have love in Cleveland Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel hopes the city still supports him after off-the-field issues.  //on.wkyc.com/1S5JcS7   Join the Conversation To   Johnny Manziel: I hope I still have love in Cleveland Matthew Florjancic, WKYC 6:05 a.m. EDT October 26, 2015 Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel hopes the city still supports him after off-the-field issues. Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel hopes the city still supports him after off-the-field issues. (Photo: Ken Blaze-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel is hoping he can count on one thing should he be named the starter for next Sunday's game against the Arizona Cardinals if veteran Josh McCown is sidelined with a shoulder injury that prevented him from finishing Sunday's loss to the St. Louis Rams. 
And that one thing is the support of Browns fans after Manziel was recently pulled over by police in the Cleveland suburb of Avon for an incident on the highway that had complaints of domestic violence levied against the second-year quarterback by his girlfriend, Colleen Crowley. 
"I know at one point in time, it was probably over the top, but I know just going back to A&M when I had the chance, I still had a lot of love there," Manziel said. "I think, hope I still have some love in the city of Cleveland, so I hope people haven't given up on me. 
"I know I'm trying to do the right things on the field, just trying to keep my head down and keep plugging and keep pushing and keep trying to gain back really what I felt like I lost last year in a rough rookie season, but that's all I'm really doing right now, just keeping my head down and continuing to plug and continuing to learn and then, making the most of my opportunities when I do get in there." 
Eye-witness calls to the police from fellow travelers along Interstate 90 detailed Manziel, who admitted to having a couple drinks downtown before going home, as driving erratically on the highway and in a physical argument with his girlfriend, who was heard on the police video saying "he hurt me several times," and also, "I'm in fear for my life." 
Despite the incident, which came to light last Friday evening, Manziel practiced all week and was active for last Sunday's 26-23 loss to the Denver Broncos at FirstEnergy Stadium, a decision that Pettine said was "based on the information we had." 
Manziel, who spent 10 weeks in a rehabilitation facility to make lifestyle changes, has appreciated the support from the Browns. 
"I love this organization," Manziel said. "These guys, from Mr. Haslam to Ray Farmer to Coach Pettine, to everybody, they treated me incredible. They stuck by me going into the offseason, through some tough times. 
"This is the place I got drafted. This is the place that means a lot to me, and I still have a lot to prove and a lot that I want to do. I haven't been in the league very long, haven't made a very big impact, but I'm hopefully getting some chances this year before the season's over to try to get out and make something happen." 
Manziel maintains that he will continue cooperating with league and team officials, but the off-the-field incident will not affect him as the Browns go through their preparations for Sunday's game against the Arizona Cardinals, which starts a three-game in 15-day stretch. 
"Obviously, that's a situation that's ongoing with the league, something that I'm fully cooperating with," Manziel said. "I'm fully answering anything, if they have to ask me in the future, but right now, it's ongoing and I'm going to leave it at that. 
"If anybody reaches out to me, if the NFL does reach out to me, I'll fully cooperate with anything they ask me, anything that they need from me. I'm not shying away from that. I've cooperated fully with Avon. I've cooperated fully with everybody in the Browns and anybody that's asked me anything. It's an ongoing situation. I don't really want to speak on it much more than that, but if the situation does arise, I'll fully cooperate. That's really it. 
"I find solace in that building. I find a sense of peace being around the guys that we have on this team, and I feel like the way that I'm treated in the building, the way that I'm treated when I'm there, I love it. I love the guys that we have on this team. When I'm in the building, when it's work time, I'm extremely excited to be in there, extremely excited to be going to work every day. I was able to stay prepared as I would any other week." Read or Share this story: http://on.wkyc.com/1S5JcS7 TOP VIDEOS
